subject: RE: [junit] Robot class in JDK 1.3
msgSnippet: We are using robots in our project for testing but it makes system so slow that we are now trying to get away from it. Also we have to provide some delay after
messageBody:
We are using robots in our project for testing but it makes system so slow
that we are now trying to get away from it. Also we have to provide some
delay after each robot call which makes whole test scenario very
unpredictable. Test passing on Integration machine have no guarantee of
running all green on staging.

But it 'd be very time consuming to rewrite all those tests again. I would
suggest either use JFCUNIT or pump the event into swing buffers thro ur test
code.

Shailesh
-----Original Message-----
From: Timothy Wall [mailto:twall@...]
Sent: Monday, May 13, 2002 5:28 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Robot class in JDK 1.3


The more recent ones are

jfcunit.sourceforge.net
jemmy.netbeans.org
abbot.sourceforge.net

there are also a number of half-finished attempts out there...

T.

On Monday, May 13, 2002, at 10:48 AM, Scott Stirling wrote:

> Interesting. I tend to stay away from GUI programming so I only just
> now noticed this class mentioned in an article on IBM's Java site.
> Check it out:
>
> http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/api/java/awt/Robot.html
>
> Has anyone here built anything off of this for unit or functional GUI
> testing?
>
> Scott Stirling
